030package squidpony.squidmath;
031
032import java.io.Serializable;
033
034/**
035 * A wide range of noise functions that can all be called from one configurable object. Originally from Jordan Peck's
036 * FastNoise library, hence the name (these functions are sometimes, but not always, very fast for noise that doesn't
037 * use the GPU). This implements Noise2D, Noise3D, Noise4D, Noise5D, and Noise6D, and this is the fastest continuous
038 * noise algorithm in the library. It also allows the most configuration of any noise generator here, and the API is
039 * quite large. Some key parts to keep in mind:
040 * <ul>
041 *     <li>The noise type, set with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}, controls what algorithm this uses to generate noise, and
042 *     affects most of the other options. Choose a "_FRACTAL" noise type like {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} (the default) if
043 *     you want to use any of the fractal options, like octaves, lacunarity, gain, or fractal type.</li>
044 *     <li>The frequency, set with {@link #setFrequency(float)}, affects how quickly significant changes in output can
045 *     occur over a given span of input values. It defaults to {@code 1f/32f}, though you should try setting this to
046 *     {@code 1f} if results look strange.</li>
047 *     <li>If your noise type is one of the fractal varieties ({@link #VALUE_FRACTAL}, {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL},
048 *     {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL}, {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL}, or {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL}):
049 *     <ul>
050 *         <li>Fractal noise can set a fractal type with {@link #setFractalType(int)}, which defaults to {@link #FBM}
051 *         (almost the same as {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Layered2D}), and can also be set to
052 *         {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} (almost the same as {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Ridged2D}) or {@link #BILLOW}
053 *         (related to RIDGED_MULTI in some ways). The noise type affects how the other fractal options work, and has a
054 *         very strong effect on the appearance of the noise when it changes.</li>
055 *         <li>Octaves, set with {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, are how many "layers" of noise this will calculate on
056 *         each call to get fractal noise. Each octave has its frequency changed based on lacunarity (set with
057 *         {@link #setFractalLacunarity(float)}), and contributes a different amount to the resulting value, based on
058 *         gain (set with {@link #setFractalGain(float)}). Generally, more octaves result in more detail and slower
059 *         generation times. {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} and {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL} only really look like noise when they
060 *         use more than one octave.</li>
061 *         <li>Lacunarity may occasionally need adjustment, but usually you're fine with setting it to 2.0 or 0.5, with
062 *         the appearance informing the decision. I think lacunarity means something related to the width of a crescent,
063 *         and refers to the exponential shape of a graph of frequency as octaves are added. It defaults to 2.0, and you
064 *         can imitate {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.InverseLayered2D} by setting it to 0.5.</li>
065 *         <li>Gain usually only needs changing if lacunarity is changed, but they can be adjusted independently. You
066 *         probably will get the best results if gain is equal to {@code 1f / lacunarity}, or close to that.</li>
067 *     </ul>
068 *     </li>
069 *     <li>In some cases, you may want unusual or symmetrical artifacts in noise; you can make this happen with
070 *     {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, giving it a {@link FlawedPointHash} or a point hash you made, and setting
071 *     noise type to {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} (or {@link #CUBIC}).</li>
072 *     <li>The {@link #CELLULAR} noise type has lots of extra configuration, and not all of it is well-documented, but
073 *     experimenting with settings like {@link #setCellularReturnType(int)} and
074 *     {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)} is a good way to see if it can do what you want.</li>
075 * </ul>
076 */
077public class FastNoise implements Serializable, Noise.Noise2D, Noise.Noise3D, Noise.Noise4D, Noise.Noise5D, Noise.Noise6D {
078    private static final long serialVersionUID = 3L;
079    /**
080     * Simple, very fast but very low-quality noise that forms a grid of squares, with their values blending at shared
081     * edges somewhat.
082     * <br>
083     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/egjotwb.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
084     * <br>
085     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
086     */
087    public static final int VALUE = 0,
088    /**
089     * Simple, very fast but very low-quality noise that forms a grid of squares, with their values blending at shared
090     * edges somewhat; this version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more, but
091     * none of these really disguise the grid it uses.
092     * <br>
093     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/egjotwb.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
094     * <br>
095     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
096     */
097    VALUE_FRACTAL = 1,
098    /**
099     * Also called Gradient Noise or Classic Perlin noise, this is fast and mid-to-low-quality in 2D, but slows down
100     * significantly in higher dimensions while mostly improving in quality. This may have a noticeable grid at 90
101     * degree angles (and a little at 45 degree angles).
102     * <br>
103     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/MO7hwSI.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
104     * <br>
105     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
106     */
107    PERLIN = 2,
108    /**
109     * Also called Gradient Noise or Classic Perlin noise, this is fast and mid-to-low-quality in 2D, but slows down
110     * significantly in higher dimensions while mostly improving in quality. This may have a noticeable grid at 90
111     * degree angles (and a little at 45 degree angles). This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)},
112     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more.
113     * <br>
114     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/MO7hwSI.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
115     * <br>
116     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
117     */
118    PERLIN_FRACTAL = 3,
119    /**
120     * Also called Improved Perlin noise, this is always fast but tends to have better quality in lower dimensions. This
121     * may have a noticeable grid at 60 degree angles, made of regular triangles in 2D.
122     * <br>
123     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wg3kq5A.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
124     * <br>
125     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
126     */
127    SIMPLEX = 4,
128    /**
129     * Also called Improved Perlin noise, this is always fast but tends to have better quality in lower dimensions. This
130     * may have a noticeable grid at 60 degree angles, made of regular triangles in 2D. This version can use
131     * {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more; it is the default noise type if none is
132     * specified.
133     * <br>
134     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wg3kq5A.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
135     * <br>
136     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
137     */
138    SIMPLEX_FRACTAL = 5,
139    /**
140     * Creates a Voronoi diagram of 2D or 3D space and fills cells based on the {@link #setCellularReturnType(int)},
141     * {@link #setCellularDistanceFunction(int)}, and possibly the {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)}. This is
142     * more of an advanced usage, but can yield useful results when oddly-shaped areas should have similar values.
143     * <br>
144     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ScRves7.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
145     * <br>
146     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
147     */
148    CELLULAR = 6,
149    /**
150     * Purely chaotic, non-continuous random noise per position; looks like static on a TV screen.
151     * <br>
152     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/vBtISSx.jpg">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
153     * <br>
154     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
155     */
156    WHITE_NOISE = 7,
157    /**
158     * A simple kind of noise that gets a random float for each vertex of a square or cube, and interpolates between all
159     * of them to get a smoothly changing value (using cubic interpolation, also called {@link #HERMITE}, of course).
160     * If you're changing the point hashing algorithm with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, you should usually use
161     * this or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} if you want to see any aesthetically-desirable artifacts in the hash.
162     * <br>
163     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/foV90pn.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
164     * <br>
165     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
166     */
167    CUBIC = 8,
168    /**
169     * A simple kind of noise that gets a random float for each vertex of a square or cube, and interpolates between all
170     * of them to get a smoothly changing value (using cubic interpolation, also called {@link #HERMITE}, of course).
171     * This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more.
172     * If you're changing the point hashing algorithm with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)}, you should usually use
173     * this or {@link #CUBIC} if you want to see any aesthetically-desirable artifacts in the hash.
174     * <br>
175     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/foV90pn.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
176     * <br>
177     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
178     */
179    CUBIC_FRACTAL = 9,
180    /**
181     * A novel kind of noise that works in n-dimensions by averaging n+1 value noise calls, all of them rotated around
182     * each other, and with all of the value noise calls after the first adding in the last call's result to part of the
183     * position. This yields rather high-quality noise (especially when comparing one octave of FOAM to one octave of
184     * {@link #PERLIN} or {@link #SIMPLEX}), but is somewhat slow.
185     * <br>
186     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/4ZC9h5t.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
187     * <br>
188     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
189     */
190    FOAM = 10,
191    /**
192     * A novel kind of noise that works in n-dimensions by averaging n+1 value noise calls, all of them rotated around
193     * each other, and with all of the value noise calls after the first adding in the last call's result to part of the
194     * position. This yields rather high-quality noise (especially when comparing one octave of FOAM to one octave of
195     * {@link #PERLIN} or {@link #SIMPLEX}), but is somewhat slow. This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)},
196     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and more, and usually doesn't need as many octaves as PERLIN or SIMPLEX to
197     * attain comparable quality.
198     * <br>
199     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/4ZC9h5t.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
200     * <br>
201     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
202     */
203    FOAM_FRACTAL = 11,
204    /**
205     * A simple combination of {@link #SIMPLEX} and {@link #VALUE} noise, averaging a call to each and then distorting
206     * the result's distribution so it isn't as centrally-biased. The result is somewhere between {@link #FOAM} and
207     * {@link #SIMPLEX}, and has less angular bias than Simplex or Value. This gets its name from how it mixes two
208     * different geometric honeycombs (a triangular one for 2D Simplex noise and a square one for 2D Value noise).
209     * <br>
210     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/bMEPiBA.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
211     * <br>
212     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
213     */
214    HONEY = 12,
215    /**
216     * A simple combination of {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} and {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL} noise, averaging a call to each and
217     * then distorting the result's distribution so it isn't as centrally-biased. The result is somewhere between
218     * {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} and {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL}, and has less angular bias than Simplex or Value. This gets
219     * its name from how it mixes two different geometric honeycombs (a triangular one for 2D Simplex noise and a square
220     * one for 2D Value noise). This version can use {@link #setFractalType(int)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and
221     * more, and usually doesn't need as many octaves as PERLIN or SIMPLEX to attain comparable quality, though it
222     * drastically improves with just two octaves.
223     * <br>
224     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/bMEPiBA.png">Noise sample at left, FFT at right.</a>
225     * <br>
226     * This is meant to be used with {@link #setNoiseType(int)}.
227     */
228    HONEY_FRACTAL = 13;
229
230    public static final int LINEAR = 0, HERMITE = 1, QUINTIC = 2;
231
232    public static final int FBM = 0, BILLOW = 1, RIDGED_MULTI = 2;
233
234    public static final int EUCLIDEAN = 0, MANHATTAN = 1, NATURAL = 2;
235
236    public static final int CELL_VALUE = 0, NOISE_LOOKUP = 1, DISTANCE = 2, DISTANCE_2 = 3,
237            DISTANCE_2_ADD = 4, DISTANCE_2_SUB = 5, DISTANCE_2_MUL = 6, DISTANCE_2_DIV = 7;
238
239    private int seed;
240    protected float frequency = 0.03125f;
241    protected int interpolation = HERMITE;
242    private int noiseType = SIMPLEX_FRACTAL;
243
244    private int octaves = 1;
245    private float lacunarity = 2f;
246    private float gain = 0.5f;
247    private int fractalType = FBM;
248
249    private float fractalBounding;
250
251    private int cellularDistanceFunction = EUCLIDEAN;
252    private int cellularReturnType = CELL_VALUE;
253    private FastNoise cellularNoiseLookup;
254    private IPointHash pointHash = new IntPointHash();
255
256    private float gradientPerturbAmp = 1f / 0.45f;
257
258    /**
259     * A publicly available FastNoise object with seed 1337, frequency 1.0f/32.0f, 1 octave of Simplex noise using
260     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType, 2f lacunarity and 0.5f gain. It's encouraged to use methods that temporarily configure
261     * this variable, like {@link #getNoiseWithSeed(float, float, int)} rather than changing its settings and using a
262     * method that needs that lasting configuration, like {@link #getConfiguredNoise(float, float)}.
263     */
264    public static final FastNoise instance = new FastNoise();
265    /**
266     * A constructor that takes no parameters, and uses all default settings with a seed of 1337. An example call to
267     * this would be {@code new FastNoise()}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a default frequency of 1.0f/32.0f, 1
268     * octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for the 
269     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the
270     * fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
271     */
272    public FastNoise() {
273        this(1337);
274    }
275
276    /**
277     * A constructor that takes only a parameter for the FastNoise's seed, which should produce different results for
278     * any different seeds. An example call to this would be {@code new FastNoise(1337)}, which makes noise with the
279     * seed 1337, a default frequency of 1.0f/32.0f, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count,
280     * it always uses 1 even for the SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call
281     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain
282     * (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
283     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
284     */
285    public FastNoise(int seed) {
286        this.seed = seed;
287        calculateFractalBounding();
288    }
289    /**
290     * A constructor that takes two parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
291     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
292     * frequency, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for the 
293     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the
294     * fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
295     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
296     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
297     */
298    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency)
299    {
300        this(seed, frequency, SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 1, 2f, 0.5f);
301    }
302    /**
303     * A constructor that takes a few parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
304     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
305     * frequency, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for 
306     * noiseTypes like SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, but using a fractal noiseType can make sense if you call
307     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
308     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
309     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
310     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
311     */
312    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType)
313    {
314        this(seed, frequency, noiseType, 1, 2f, 0.5f);
315    }
316
317    /**
318     * A constructor that takes several parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
319     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 4)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
320     * frequency, 4 octaves of Simplex noise, and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
321     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
322     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
323     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
324     * @param octaves how many octaves of noise to use when the noiseType is one of the _FRACTAL types
325     */
326    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType, int octaves)
327    {
328        this(seed, frequency, noiseType, octaves, 2f, 0.5f);
329    }
330
331    /**
332     * A constructor that takes a lot of parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
333     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 4, 0.5f, 2f)}, which makes noise with a
334     * lower frequency, 4 octaves of Simplex noise, and the "inverse" effect on how those octaves work (which makes
335     * the extra added octaves be more significant to the final result and also have a lower frequency, while normally
336     * added octaves have a higher frequency and tend to have a minor effect on the large-scale shape of the noise).
337     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
338     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
339     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
340     * @param octaves how many octaves of noise to use when the noiseType is one of the _FRACTAL types
341     * @param lacunarity typically 2.0, or 0.5 to change how extra octaves work (inverse mode) 
342     * @param gain typically 0.5, or 2.0 to change how extra octaves work (inverse mode)
343     */
344    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType, int octaves, float lacunarity, float gain)
345    {
346        this.seed = seed;
347        this.frequency = Math.max(0.0001f, frequency);
348        this.noiseType = noiseType;
349        this.octaves = octaves;
350        this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
351        this.gain = gain;
352        calculateFractalBounding();
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Copy constructor; copies all non-temporary fields from  {@code other} into this. This uses the same reference to
357     * an {@link IPointHash} set with {@link #setPointHash(IPointHash)} and to another FastNoise set with
358     * {@link #setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise)}, but otherwise everything it copies is a primitive.
359     * @param other another FastNoise, which must not be null
360     */
361    public FastNoise(final FastNoise other) {
362        this(other.seed, other.frequency, other.noiseType, other.octaves, other.lacunarity, other.gain);
363        this.pointHash = other.pointHash;
364        this.interpolation = other.interpolation;
365        this.gradientPerturbAmp = other.gradientPerturbAmp;
366        this.cellularReturnType = other.cellularReturnType;
367        this.cellularDistanceFunction = other.cellularDistanceFunction;
368        this.cellularNoiseLookup = other.cellularNoiseLookup;
369    }
370
371    protected static float dotf(final float[] g, final float x, final float y) {
372        return g[0] * x + g[1] * y;
373    }
374
375    /**
376     * @return Returns the seed used by this object
377     */
378    public int getSeed() {
379        return seed;
380    }
381
382    /**
383     * Sets the seed used for all noise types, as a long.
384     * If this is not called, defaults to 1337L.
385     * @param seed a seed as a long
386     */
387    public void setSeed(int seed) {
388        this.seed = seed;
389    }
390
391    /**
392     * Sets the frequency for all noise types. If this is not called, it defaults to 0.03125f (or 1f/32f).
393     * This setter validates the frequency, and won't set it to a float less than 0.0001f, which is small enough that
394     * floating-point precision could be an issue. Lots of things may expect this to be higher than the default,
395     * especially code that is meant to be compatible across {@link squidpony.squidmath.Noise.Noise2D} and similar
396     * interfaces; try setting frequency to {@code 1.0f} if you experience issues.
397     * @param frequency the frequency for all noise types, as a positive non-zero float
398     */
399    public void setFrequency(float frequency) {
400        this.frequency = Math.max(0.0001f, frequency);
401    }
402
403    /**
404     * Gets the frequency for all noise types. The default is 0.03125f, or 1f/32f.
405     * @return the frequency for all noise types, which should be a positive non-zero float
406     */
407    public float getFrequency()
408    {
409        return frequency;
410    }
411
412    /**
413     * Changes the interpolation method used to smooth between noise values, using on of the following constants from
414     * this class (lowest to highest quality): {@link #LINEAR} (0), {@link #HERMITE} (1), or {@link #QUINTIC} (2). If
415     * this is not called, it defaults to HERMITE. This is used in Value, Perlin, and Position Perturbing.
416     * @param interpolation an int (0, 1, or 2) corresponding  to a constant from this class for an interpolation level
417     */
418    public void setInterpolation(int interpolation) {
419        this.interpolation = interpolation;
420    }
421
422    /**
423     * Sets the default type of noise returned by {@link #getConfiguredNoise(float, float)}, using one of the following constants
424     * in this class:
425     * {@link #VALUE} (0), {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL} (1), {@link #PERLIN} (2), {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL} (3),
426     * {@link #SIMPLEX} (4), {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} (5), {@link #CELLULAR} (6), {@link #WHITE_NOISE} (7),
427     * {@link #CUBIC} (8), {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} (9), {@link #FOAM} (10), or {@link #FOAM_FRACTAL} (11).
428     * If this isn't called, getConfiguredNoise() will default to SIMPLEX_FRACTAL.
429     * @param noiseType an int from 0 to 9 corresponding to a constant from this class for a noise type
430     */
431    public void setNoiseType(int noiseType) {
432        this.noiseType = noiseType;

717    protected static int fastFloor(float f) {
718        return (f >= 0 ? (int) f : (int) f - 1);
719    }
720
721
722    protected static int fastRound(float f) {
723        return (f >= 0) ? (int) (f + 0.5f) : (int) (f - 0.5f);
724    }
725
726
727    private static float lerp(float a, float b, float t) {
728        return a + t * (b - a);
729    }
730
731
732    protected static float hermiteInterpolator(float t) {
733        return t * t * (3 - 2 * t);
734    }
735
736
737    protected static float quinticInterpolator(float t) {
738        return t * t * t * (t * (t * 6 - 15) + 10);
739    }
740
741    protected static float cubicLerp(float a, float b, float c, float d, float t) {
742        float p = (d - c) - (a - b);
743        return t * (t * t * p + t * ((a - b) - p) + (c - a)) + b;
744    }
745
746    private void calculateFractalBounding() {
747        float amp = gain;
748        float ampFractal = 1;
749        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
750            ampFractal += amp;
751            amp *= gain;
752        }
753        fractalBounding = 1 / ampFractal;
754    }
755
756    private float valCoord2D(int seed, int x, int y) {
757        return (hashAll(x, y, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
758    }
759
760    private float valCoord3D(int seed, int x, int y, int z) {
761        return (hashAll(x, y, z, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
762    }
763
764    private float valCoord4D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w) {
765        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
766    }
767
768    private float valCoord5D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u) {
769        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
770    }
771
772    private float valCoord6D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v) {
773        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
774    }
775
776    protected float gradCoord2D(int seed, int x, int y, float xd, float yd) {
777        final float[] g = phiGrad2f[hash256(x, y, seed)];
778        return xd * g[0] + yd * g[1];
779    }
780
781    protected float gradCoord3D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, float xd, float yd, float zd) {
782        final Float3 g = GRAD_3D[hash32(x, y, z, seed)];
783        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z;
784    }
785
786    protected float gradCoord4D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd) {
787        final int hash = hash256(x, y, z, w, seed) & 0xFC;
788        return xd * grad4f[hash] + yd * grad4f[hash + 1] + zd * grad4f[hash + 2] + wd * grad4f[hash + 3];
789    }
790
791    protected float gradCoord5D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u,
792                                       float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd, float ud) {
793        final Float5 g = grad5f[hash256(x, y, z, w, u, seed)];
794        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z + wd * g.w + ud * g.u;
795    }
796
797    protected float gradCoord6D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v,
798                                       float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd, float ud, float vd) {
799        final Float6 g = grad6f[hash256(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed)];
800        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z + wd * g.w + ud * g.u + vd * g.v;
801    }

803
804    /**
805     * After being configured with the setters in this class, such as {@link #setNoiseType(int)},
806     * {@link #setFrequency(float)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and {@link #setFractalType(int)}, among others,
807     * you can call this method to get the particular variety of noise you specified, in 2D.
808     * @param x
809     * @param y
810     * @return noise as a float from -1f to 1f
811     */
812    public float getConfiguredNoise(float x, float y) {
813        x *= frequency;
814        y *= frequency;
815
816        switch (noiseType) {
817            case VALUE:
818                return singleValue(seed, x, y);
819            case VALUE_FRACTAL:
820                switch (fractalType) {
821                    case BILLOW:
822                        return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y);
823                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
824                        return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
825                    default:
826                        return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y);
827                }
828            case FOAM:
829                return singleFoam(seed, x, y);
830            case FOAM_FRACTAL:
831                switch (fractalType) {
832                    case BILLOW:
833                        return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y);
834                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
835                        return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
836                    default:
837                        return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y);
838                }
839            case HONEY:
840                return singleHoney(seed, x, y);
841            case HONEY_FRACTAL:
842                switch (fractalType) {
843                    case BILLOW:
844                        return singleHoneyFractalBillow(x, y);
845                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
846                        return singleHoneyFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
847                    default:
848                        return singleHoneyFractalFBM(x, y);
849                }
850            case PERLIN:
851                return singlePerlin(seed, x, y);
852            case PERLIN_FRACTAL:
853                switch (fractalType) {
854                    case BILLOW:
855                        return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y);
856                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
857                        return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
858                    default:
859                        return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y);
860                }
861            case SIMPLEX_FRACTAL:
862                switch (fractalType) {
863                    case BILLOW:
864                        return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y);
865                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
866                        return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
867                    default:
868                        return singleSimplexFractalFBM(x, y);
869                }
870            case CELLULAR:
871                switch (cellularReturnType) {
872                    case CELL_VALUE:
873                    case NOISE_LOOKUP:
874                    case DISTANCE:
875                        return singleCellular(x, y);
876                    default:
877                        return singleCellular2Edge(x, y);
878                }
879            case WHITE_NOISE:
880                return getWhiteNoise(x, y);
881            case CUBIC:
882                return singleCubic(seed, x, y);
883            case CUBIC_FRACTAL:
884                switch (fractalType) {
885                    case BILLOW:
886                        return singleCubicFractalBillow(x, y);
887                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
888                        return singleCubicFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
889                    default:
890                        return singleCubicFractalFBM(x, y);
891                }
892            default:
893                return singleSimplex(seed, x, y);
894        }
895    }
896
897    /**
898     * After being configured with the setters in this class, such as {@link #setNoiseType(int)},
899     * {@link #setFrequency(float)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and {@link #setFractalType(int)}, among others,
900     * you can call this method to get the particular variety of noise you specified, in 3D.
901     * @param x
902     * @param y
903     * @param z
904     * @return noise as a float from -1f to 1f
905     */
906    public float getConfiguredNoise(float x, float y, float z) {
907        x *= frequency;
908        y *= frequency;
909        z *= frequency;
910
911        switch (noiseType) {
912            case VALUE:
913                return singleValue(seed, x, y, z);
914            case VALUE_FRACTAL:
915                switch (fractalType) {
916                    case BILLOW:
917                        return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z);
918                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
919                        return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
920                    default:
921                        return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z);
922                }
923            case FOAM:
924                return singleFoam(seed, x, y, z);
925            case FOAM_FRACTAL:
926                switch (fractalType) {
927                    case BILLOW:
928                        return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y, z);
929                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
930                        return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
931                    default:
932                        return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y, z);
933                }
934            case HONEY:
935                return singleHoney(seed, x, y, z);
936            case HONEY_FRACTAL:
937                switch (fractalType) {
938                    case BILLOW:
939                        return singleHoneyFractalBillow(x, y, z);
940                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
941                        return singleHoneyFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
942                    default:
943                        return singleHoneyFractalFBM(x, y, z);
944                }
945            case PERLIN:
946                return singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z);
947            case PERLIN_FRACTAL:
948                switch (fractalType) {
949                    case BILLOW:
950                        return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y, z);
951                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
952                        return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
953                    default:
954                        return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y, z);
955                }
956            case SIMPLEX_FRACTAL:
957                switch (fractalType) {
958                    case BILLOW:
959                        return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y, z);
960                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
961                        return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
962                    default:
963                        return singleSimplexFractalFBM(x, y, z);
964                }
965            case CELLULAR:
966                switch (cellularReturnType) {
967                    case CELL_VALUE:
968                    case NOISE_LOOKUP:
969                    case DISTANCE:
970                        return singleCellular(x, y, z);
971                    default:
972                        return singleCellular2Edge(x, y, z);
973                }
974            case WHITE_NOISE:
975                return getWhiteNoise(x, y, z);
976            case CUBIC:
977                return singleCubic(seed, x, y, z);
978            case CUBIC_FRACTAL:
979                switch (fractalType) {
980                    case BILLOW:
981                        return singleCubicFractalBillow(x, y, z);
982                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
983                        return singleCubicFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
984                    default:
985                        return singleCubicFractalFBM(x, y, z);
986                }
987            default:
988                return singleSimplex(seed, x, y, z);
989        }
990    }
991    /**
992     * After being configured with the setters in this class, such as {@link #setNoiseType(int)},
993     * {@link #setFrequency(float)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and {@link #setFractalType(int)}, among others,
994     * you can call this method to get the particular variety of noise you specified, in 4D.
995     * @param x
996     * @param y
997     * @param z
998     * @param w
999     * @return noise as a float from -1f to 1f
1000     */
1001    public float getConfiguredNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1002        x *= frequency;
1003        y *= frequency;
1004        z *= frequency;
1005        w *= frequency;
1006
1007        switch (noiseType) {
1008            case VALUE:
1009                return singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w);
1010            case VALUE_FRACTAL:

1016                    default:
1017                        return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w);
1018                }
1019            case FOAM:
1020                return singleFoam(seed, x, y, z, w);
1021            case FOAM_FRACTAL:
1022                switch (fractalType) {
1023                    case BILLOW:
1024                        return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y, z, w);
1025                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1026                        return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w);
1027                    default:
1028                        return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y, z, w);
1029                }
1030            case HONEY:
1031                return singleHoney(seed, x, y, z, w);
1032            case HONEY_FRACTAL:
1033                switch (fractalType) {
1034                    case BILLOW:
1035                        return singleHoneyFractalBillow(x, y, z, w);
1036                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1037                        return singleHoneyFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w);
1038                    default:

1040                }
1041            case PERLIN:
1042                return singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w);
1043            case PERLIN_FRACTAL:
1044                switch (fractalType) {
1045                    case BILLOW:
1046                        return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y, z, w);
1047                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1048                        return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w);
1049                    default:
1050                        return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y, z, w);
1051                }

1053                switch (fractalType) {
1054                    case BILLOW:
1055                        return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y, z, w);
1056                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1057                        return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w);
1058                    default:

1061//            case CELLULAR:

1065//                    case DISTANCE:
1066//                        return singleCellular(x, y, z);

1239    private int floatToIntMixed(final float f) {
1240        final int i = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(f);
1241        return i ^ i >>> 16;
1242    }
1243

1245        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1246        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1247
1248        return valCoord2D(seed, xi, yi);
1249    }

1309    // Value Noise
1310    //x should be premultiplied by 0xD1B55
1311    //y should be premultiplied by 0xABC99
1312    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, int s) {
1313        s += x ^ y;
1314        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1315    }
1316    //x should be premultiplied by 0xDB4F1
1317    //y should be premultiplied by 0xBBE05
1318    //z should be premultiplied by 0xA0F2F
1319    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, int s) {
1320        s += x ^ y ^ z;
1321        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1322    }
1323    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE19B1
1324    //y should be premultiplied by 0xC6D1D
1325    //z should be premultiplied by 0xAF36D
1326    //w should be premultiplied by 0x9A695
1327    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, int s) {
1328        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w;
1329        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1330    }
1331
1332    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE60E3
1333    //y should be premultiplied by 0xCEBD7
1334    //z should be premultiplied by 0xB9C9B
1335    //w should be premultiplied by 0xA6F57
1336    //u should be premultiplied by 0x9609D
1337    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, final int u, int s) {
1338        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w ^ u;
1339        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1340    }
1341
1342    //x should be premultiplied by 0xE95E1
1343    //y should be premultiplied by 0xD4BC7
1344    //z should be premultiplied by 0xC1EDB
1345    //w should be premultiplied by 0xB0C8B
1346    //u should be premultiplied by 0xA127B
1347    //v should be premultiplied by 0x92E85
1348    private static int hashPart1024(final int x, final int y, final int z, final int w, final int u, final int v, int s) {
1349        s += x ^ y ^ z ^ w ^ u ^ v;
1350        return (s ^ (s << 19 | s >>> 13) ^ (s << 5 | s >>> 27) ^ 0xD1B54A35) * 0x125493 >> 22;
1351    }
1352
1353
1354    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y) {
1355        x *= frequency;
1356        y *= frequency;
1357
1358        switch (fractalType) {
1359            case FBM:
1360                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y);
1361            case BILLOW:
1362                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y);
1363            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1364                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1365            default:
1366                return 0;
1367        }
1368    }
1369
1370    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
1371        int seed = this.seed;
1372        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y);
1373        float amp = 1;
1374
1375        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1376            x *= lacunarity;
1377            y *= lacunarity;
1378
1379            amp *= gain;
1380            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y) * amp;
1381        }
1382
1383        return sum * fractalBounding;
1384    }
1385
1386    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
1387        int seed = this.seed;
1388        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
1389        float amp = 1;
1390
1391        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1392            x *= lacunarity;
1393            y *= lacunarity;
1394            amp *= gain;
1395            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1396        }
1397
1398        return sum * fractalBounding;
1399    }
1400
1401    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
1402        int seed = this.seed;
1403        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
1404        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1405            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y));
1406            spike *= spike * amp;
1407            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
1408            sum += (spike * ampBias);
1409            ampBias *= 2f;
1410            x *= lacunarity;
1411            y *= lacunarity;
1412        }
1413        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
1414    }
1415
1416    public float getValue(float x, float y) {
1417        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency);
1418    }
1419
1420
1421    public float singleValue (int seed, float x, float y) {
1422        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1423        x -= xFloor;
1424        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1425        y -= yFloor;
1426        switch (interpolation) {
1427            case HERMITE:
1428                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1429                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1430                break;
1431            case QUINTIC:
1432                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
1433                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
1434                break;
1435        }
1436        xFloor *= 0xD1B55;
1437        yFloor *= 0xABC99;
1438        return ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor, seed))
1439                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed)))
1440                * 0x1p-9f;
1441    }
1442
1443    /**
1444     * Produces noise from 0 to 1, instead of the normal -1 to 1.
1445     * @param seed
1446     * @param x
1447     * @param y
1448     * @return noise from 0 to 1.
1449     */
1450    protected float valueNoise (int seed, float x, float y) {
1451        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1452        x -= xFloor;
1453        x *= x * (3 - 2 * x);
1454        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1455        y -= yFloor;
1456        y *= y * (3 - 2 * y);
1457        xFloor *= 0xD1B55;
1458        yFloor *= 0xABC99;
1459        return ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor, seed))
1460                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xD1B55, yFloor + 0xABC99, seed)))
1461                * 0x1p-10f + 0.5f;
1462    }
1463    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z) {
1464        x *= frequency;
1465        y *= frequency;
1466        z *= frequency;
1467
1468        switch (fractalType) {
1469            case BILLOW:
1470                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z);
1471            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1472                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1473            default:
1474                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1475        }
1476    }
1477
1478    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z) {
1479        int seed = this.seed;
1480        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y, z);
1481        float amp = 1;
1482
1483        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1484            x *= lacunarity;
1485            y *= lacunarity;
1486            z *= lacunarity;
1487
1488            amp *= gain;
1489            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z) * amp;
1490        }
1491
1492        return sum * fractalBounding;
1493    }
1494
1495    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z) {
1496        int seed = this.seed;
1497        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y, z)) * 2 - 1;
1498        float amp = 1;
1499
1500        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1501            x *= lacunarity;
1502            y *= lacunarity;
1503            z *= lacunarity;
1504
1505            amp *= gain;
1506            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y, z)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1507        }
1508
1509        return sum * fractalBounding;
1510    }
1511
1512    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z) {
1513        int seed = this.seed;
1514        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
1515        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1516            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z));
1517            spike *= spike * amp;
1518            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
1519            sum += (spike * ampBias);
1520            ampBias *= 2f;
1521            x *= lacunarity;
1522            y *= lacunarity;
1523            z *= lacunarity;
1524        }
1525        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
1526    }
1527
1528    public float getValue(float x, float y, float z) {
1529        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency);
1530    }
1531
1532    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z) {
1533        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1534        x -= xFloor;
1535        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1536        y -= yFloor;
1537        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
1538        z -= zFloor;
1539        switch (interpolation) {
1540            case HERMITE:
1541                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1542                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1543                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
1544                break;
1545            case QUINTIC:
1546                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
1547                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
1548                z = quinticInterpolator(z);
1549                break;
1550        }
1551        //0xDB4F1, 0xBBE05, 0xA0F2F
1552        xFloor *= 0xDB4F1;
1553        yFloor *= 0xBBE05;
1554        zFloor *= 0xA0F2F;
1555        return ((1 - z) *
1556                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor, zFloor, seed))
1557                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor, seed)))
1558                + z *
1559                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed))
1560                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed)))
1561        ) * 0x1p-9f;
1562    }
1563    /**
1564     * Produces noise from 0 to 1, instead of the normal -1 to 1.
1565     * @param seed
1566     * @param x
1567     * @param y
1568     * @param z
1569     * @return noise from 0 to 1.
1570     */
1571    protected float valueNoise(int seed, float x, float y, float z)
1572    {
1573        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1574        x -= xFloor;
1575        x *= x * (3 - 2 * x);
1576        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1577        y -= yFloor;
1578        y *= y * (3 - 2 * y);
1579        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
1580        z -= zFloor;
1581        z *= z * (3 - 2 * z);
1582        //0xDB4F1, 0xBBE05, 0xA0F2F
1583        xFloor *= 0xDB4F1;
1584        yFloor *= 0xBBE05;
1585        zFloor *= 0xA0F2F;
1586        return ((1 - z) *
1587                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor, zFloor, seed))
1588                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor, seed)))
1589                + z *
1590                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed))
1591                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xDB4F1, yFloor + 0xBBE05, zFloor + 0xA0F2F, seed)))
1592        ) * 0x1p-10f + 0.5f;
1593
1594    }
1595    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1596        x *= frequency;
1597        y *= frequency;
1598        z *= frequency;
1599        w *= frequency;
1600
1601        switch (fractalType) {
1602            case BILLOW:
1603                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z, w);
1604            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1605                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w);
1606            default:
1607                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w);
1608        }
1609    }
1610
1611    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1612        int seed = this.seed;
1613        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w);
1614        float amp = 1;
1615
1616        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1617            x *= lacunarity;
1618            y *= lacunarity;
1619            z *= lacunarity;
1620            w *= lacunarity;
1621
1622            amp *= gain;
1623            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w) * amp;
1624        }
1625
1626        return sum * fractalBounding;
1627    }
1628
1629    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1630        int seed = this.seed;
1631        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w)) * 2 - 1;
1632        float amp = 1;
1633
1634        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1635            x *= lacunarity;
1636            y *= lacunarity;
1637            z *= lacunarity;
1638            w *= lacunarity;
1639
1640            amp *= gain;
1641            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1642        }
1643
1644        return sum * fractalBounding;
1645    }
1646
1647    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1648        int seed = this.seed;
1649        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
1650        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1651            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z, w));
1652            spike *= spike * amp;
1653            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
1654            sum += (spike * ampBias);
1655            ampBias *= 2f;
1656            x *= lacunarity;
1657            y *= lacunarity;
1658            z *= lacunarity;
1659            w *= lacunarity;
1660        }
1661        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
1662    }
1663
1664    public float getValue(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1665        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency);
1666    }
1667
1668    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1669        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1670        x -= xFloor;
1671        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1672        y -= yFloor;
1673        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
1674        z -= zFloor;
1675        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
1676        w -= wFloor;
1677        switch (interpolation) {
1678            case HERMITE:
1679                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1680                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1681                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
1682                w = hermiteInterpolator(w);
1683                break;
1684            case QUINTIC:
1685                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
1686                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
1687                z = quinticInterpolator(z);
1688                w = quinticInterpolator(w);
1689                break;
1690        }
1691        //0xE19B1, 0xC6D1D, 0xAF36D, 0x9A695
1692        xFloor *= 0xE19B1;
1693        yFloor *= 0xC6D1D;
1694        zFloor *= 0xAF36D;
1695        wFloor *= 0x9A695;
1696        return ((1 - w) *
1697                ((1 - z) *
1698                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, seed))
1699                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor, seed)))
1700                        + z *
1701                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor, seed))
1702                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor, seed))))
1703                + (w *
1704                ((1 - z) *
1705                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed))
1706                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed)))
1707                        + z *
1708                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed))
1709                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed)))
1710                ))) * 0x1p-9f;
1711    }
1712    protected float valueNoise(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w)

1714        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;

1723        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;

1728        yFloor *= 0xC6D1D;
1729        zFloor *= 0xAF36D;

1732                ((1 - z) *
1733                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, seed))
1734                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor, seed)))
1735                        + z *
1736                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor, seed))
1737                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor, seed))))
1738                + (w *
1739                ((1 - z) *
1740                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed))
1741                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed)))

1744                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE19B1, yFloor + 0xC6D1D, zFloor + 0xAF36D, wFloor + 0x9A695, seed)))

1750        y *= frequency;
1751        z *= frequency;
1752        w *= frequency;
1753        u *= frequency;
1754
1755        switch (fractalType) {
1756            case BILLOW:
1757                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z, w, u);
1758            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1759                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w, u);
1760            default:
1761                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w, u);
1762        }
1763    }
1764    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {

1767        float amp = 1;
1768
1769        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1770            x *= lacunarity;
1771            y *= lacunarity;
1772            z *= lacunarity;
1773            w *= lacunarity;
1774            u *= lacunarity;
1775            
1776            amp *= gain;
1777            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u) * amp;
1778        }
1779
1780        return sum * fractalBounding;
1781    }

1806            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u));

1824    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1825        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1826        x -= xFloor;
1827        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1828        y -= yFloor;
1829        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
1830        z -= zFloor;
1831        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
1832        w -= wFloor;
1833        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
1834        u -= uFloor;
1835        switch (interpolation) {
1836            case HERMITE:
1837                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
1838                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
1839                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
1840                w = hermiteInterpolator(w);
1841                u = hermiteInterpolator(u);
1842                break;
1843            case QUINTIC:
1844                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
1845                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
1846                z = quinticInterpolator(z);
1847                w = quinticInterpolator(w);
1848                u = quinticInterpolator(u);
1849                break;

1851        //0xE60E3, 0xCEBD7, 0xB9C9B, 0xA6F57, 0x9609D, 0x86D51

1853        yFloor *= 0xCEBD7;
1854        zFloor *= 0xB9C9B;

1858                ((1 - w) *
1859                        ((1 - z) *
1860                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
1861                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed)))
1862                                + z *
1863                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))
1864                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))))
1865                        + (w *
1866                        ((1 - z) *
1867                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
1868                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))
1869                                + z *
1870                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed))
1871                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor, seed)))
1872                        )))
1873                + (u *
1874                ((1 - w) *
1875                        ((1 - z) *
1876                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
1877                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))

1881                        + (w *
1882                        ((1 - z) *
1883                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
1884                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))
1885                                + z *
1886                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed))
1887                                        + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor + 0xCEBD7, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor + 0xA6F57, uFloor + 0x9609D, seed)))

1892    protected float valueNoise(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u) {
1893        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
1894        x -= xFloor;
1895        x *= x * (3 - 2 * x);
1896        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
1897        y -= yFloor;
1898        y *= y * (3 - 2 * y);
1899        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
1900        z -= zFloor;
1901        z *= z * (3 - 2 * z);
1902        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
1903        w -= wFloor;
1904        w *= w * (3 - 2 * w);
1905        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
1906        u -= uFloor;
1907        u *= u * (3 - 2 * u);
1908        //0xE60E3, 0xCEBD7, 0xB9C9B, 0xA6F57, 0x9609D, 0x86D51
1909        xFloor *= 0xE60E3;
1910        yFloor *= 0xCEBD7;
1911        zFloor *= 0xB9C9B;
1912        wFloor *= 0xA6F57;
1913        uFloor *= 0x9609D;
1914        return ((1 - u) *
1915                ((1 - w) *
1916                        ((1 - z) *
1917                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, seed))

1920                                ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE60E3, yFloor, zFloor + 0xB9C9B, wFloor, uFloor, seed))

1948
1949    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1950        x *= frequency;
1951        y *= frequency;
1952        z *= frequency;
1953        w *= frequency;
1954        u *= frequency;
1955        v *= frequency;
1956
1957        switch (fractalType) {
1958            case BILLOW:
1959                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1960            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1961                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1962            default:
1963                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1964        }
1965    }
1966    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1967        int seed = this.seed;
1968        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v);
1969        float amp = 1;
1970
1971        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1972            x *= lacunarity;
1973            y *= lacunarity;
1974            z *= lacunarity;
1975            w *= lacunarity;
1976            u *= lacunarity;
1977            v *= lacunarity;
1978
1979            amp *= gain;
1980            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u, v) * amp;
1981        }
1982
1983        return sum * fractalBounding;
1984    }
1985
1986    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1987        int seed = this.seed;
1988        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v)) * 2 - 1;
1989        float amp = 1;
1990
1991        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1992            x *= lacunarity;
1993            y *= lacunarity;
1994            z *= lacunarity;
1995            w *= lacunarity;
1996            u *= lacunarity;
1997            v *= lacunarity;
1998
1999            amp *= gain;
2000            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u, v)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
2001        }
2002
2003        return sum * fractalBounding;
2004    }
2005
2006    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2007        int seed = this.seed;
2008        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
2009        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
2010            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u, v));
2011            spike *= spike * amp;
2012            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
2013            sum += (spike * ampBias);
2014            ampBias *= 2f;
2015            x *= lacunarity;
2016            y *= lacunarity;
2017            z *= lacunarity;
2018            w *= lacunarity;
2019            u *= lacunarity;
2020            v *= lacunarity;
2021        }
2022        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
2023    }
2024
2025    public float getValue(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2026        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency, u * frequency, v * frequency);
2027    }

2029    public float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2030        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
2031        x -= xFloor;
2032        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
2033        y -= yFloor;
2034        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
2035        z -= zFloor;
2036        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
2037        w -= wFloor;
2038        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
2039        u -= uFloor;
2040        int vFloor = v >= 0 ? (int) v : (int) v - 1;
2041        v -= vFloor;
2042        switch (interpolation) {
2043            case HERMITE:
2044                x = hermiteInterpolator(x);
2045                y = hermiteInterpolator(y);
2046                z = hermiteInterpolator(z);
2047                w = hermiteInterpolator(w);
2048                u = hermiteInterpolator(u);
2049                v = hermiteInterpolator(v);
2050                break;
2051            case QUINTIC:
2052                x = quinticInterpolator(x);
2053                y = quinticInterpolator(y);
2054                z = quinticInterpolator(z);
2055                w = quinticInterpolator(w);
2056                u = quinticInterpolator(u);
2057                v = quinticInterpolator(v);
2058                break;

2060        //0xE95E1, 0xD4BC7, 0xC1EDB, 0xB0C8B, 0xA1279, 0x92E85

2072                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor, seed)))
2073                                        + z *
2074                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor, seed))
2075                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor, seed))))
2076                                + (w *
2077                                ((1 - z) *
2078                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor, vFloor, seed))
2079                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor, vFloor, seed)))
2080                                        + z *
2081                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor, vFloor, seed))
2082                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor + 0xC1EDB, wFloor + 0xB0C8B, uFloor, vFloor, seed)))
2083                                )))
2084                        + (u *
2085                        ((1 - w) *
2086                                ((1 - z) *
2087                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor + 0xA127B, vFloor, seed))

2105                                                + y * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor + 0xD4BC7, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor + 0x92E85, seed)))

2135
2136    protected float valueNoise(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2137        int xFloor = x >= 0 ? (int) x : (int) x - 1;
2138        x -= xFloor;
2139        x *= x * (3 - 2 * x);
2140        int yFloor = y >= 0 ? (int) y : (int) y - 1;
2141        y -= yFloor;
2142        y *= y * (3 - 2 * y);
2143        int zFloor = z >= 0 ? (int) z : (int) z - 1;
2144        z -= zFloor;
2145        z *= z * (3 - 2 * z);
2146        int wFloor = w >= 0 ? (int) w : (int) w - 1;
2147        w -= wFloor;
2148        w *= w * (3 - 2 * w);
2149        int uFloor = u >= 0 ? (int) u : (int) u - 1;
2150        u -= uFloor;
2151        u *= u * (3 - 2 * u);
2152        int vFloor = v >= 0 ? (int) v : (int) v - 1;
2153        v -= vFloor;
2154        v *= v * (3 - 2 * v);
2155        //0xE95E1, 0xD4BC7, 0xC1EDB, 0xB0C8B, 0xA1279, 0x92E85
2156        xFloor *= 0xE95E1;
2157        yFloor *= 0xD4BC7;
2158        zFloor *= 0xC1EDB;
2159        wFloor *= 0xB0C8B;
2160        uFloor *= 0xA127B;
2161        vFloor *= 0x92E85;
2162        return ((1 - v) *
2163                ((1 - u) *
2164                        ((1 - w) *
2165                                ((1 - z) *
2166                                        ((1 - y) * ((1 - x) * hashPart1024(xFloor, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor, seed) + x * hashPart1024(xFloor + 0xE95E1, yFloor, zFloor, wFloor, uFloor, vFloor, seed))

2231    // Foam Noise

2233    public float getFoam(float x, float y) {
2234        return singleFoam(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency);
2235    }
2236
2237    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y) {
2238        final float p0 = x;
2239        final float p1 = x * -0.5f + y * 0.8660254037844386f;
2240        final float p2 = x * -0.5f + y * -0.8660254037844387f;
2241
2242        float xin = p2;
2243        float yin = p0;
2244        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin);
2245        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2246        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2247        xin = p1;
2248        yin = p2;
2249        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin);
2250        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2251        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2252        xin = p0;
2253        yin = p1;
2254        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin);
2255        final float result = (a + b + c) * F3;
2256        return (result <= 0.5f)
2257                ? (result * result * 4) - 1
2258                : 1 - ((result - 1) * (result - 1) * 4);
2259    }
2260
2261    public float getFoamFractal(float x, float y) {
2262        x *= frequency;
2263        y *= frequency;
2264
2265        switch (fractalType) {
2266            case FBM:
2267                return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y);
2268            case BILLOW:
2269                return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y);
2270            case RIDGED_MULTI:
2271                return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
2272            default:
2273                return 0;
2274        }
2275    }
2276
2277    private float singleFoamFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
2278        int seed = this.seed;
2279        float sum = singleFoam(seed, x, y);
2280        float amp = 1, t;
2281
2282        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2283            t = x;
2284            x = y * lacunarity;
2285            y = t * lacunarity;
2286
2287            amp *= gain;
2288            sum += singleFoam(seed + i, x, y) * amp;
2289        }
2290
2291        return sum * fractalBounding;
2292    }
2293
2294    private float singleFoamFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
2295        int seed = this.seed;
2296        float sum = Math.abs(singleFoam(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
2297        float amp = 1, t;
2298
2299        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2300            t = x;
2301            x = y * lacunarity;
2302            y = t * lacunarity;
2303
2304            amp *= gain;
2305            sum += (Math.abs(singleFoam(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
2306        }
2307
2308        return sum * fractalBounding;
2309    }
2310
2311    private float singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
2312        int seed = this.seed;
2313        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike, t;
2314        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
2315            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleFoam(seed + i, x, y));
2316            spike *= spike * amp;
2317            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
2318            sum += (spike * ampBias);
2319            ampBias *= 2f;
2320            t = x;
2321            x = y * lacunarity;
2322            y = t * lacunarity;
2323        }
2324        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
2325    }

2334            case FBM:
2335                return singleFoamFractalFBM(x, y, z);

2337                return singleFoamFractalBillow(x, y, z);
2338            case RIDGED_MULTI:
2339                return singleFoamFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
2340            default:
2341                return 0;
2342        }
2343    }

2398
2399    public float singleFoam(int seed, float x, float y, float z){
2400        final float p0 = x;
2401        final float p1 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * 0.9428090415820634f;
2402        final float p2 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * -0.4714045207910317f + z * 0.816496580927726f;
2403        final float p3 = x * -0.3333333333333333f + y * -0.4714045207910317f + z * -0.816496580927726f;
2404
2405        float xin = p3;
2406        float yin = p2;
2407        float zin = p0;
2408        final float a = valueNoise(seed, xin, yin, zin);
2409        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2410        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2411        xin = p0;
2412        yin = p1;
2413        zin = p3;
2414        final float b = valueNoise(seed, xin + a, yin, zin);
2415        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2416        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2417        xin = p1;
2418        yin = p2;
2419        zin = p3;
2420        final float c = valueNoise(seed, xin + b, yin, zin);
2421        seed += 0x9E3779BD;
2422        seed ^= seed >>> 14;
2423        xin = p0;
2424        yin = p1;
2425        zin = p2;
2426        final float d = valueNoise(seed, xin + c, yin, zin);
2427
2428        float result = (a + b + c + d) * 0.25f;
2429        if(result <= 0.5){
2430            result *= 2;
2431            return result * result * result - 1;
2432        }
2433        else {
2434            result = (result - 1) * 2;
2435            return result * result * result + 1;
2436        }
2437    }

2449            w *= lacunarity;
2450
2451            amp *= gain;
2452            sum += singleFoam(++seed, x, y, z, w) * amp;
